alert.note: Alert for Lancaster; York (Pennsylvania) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Flood Advisory issued September 12 at 4:21PM EDT by NWS State College
info.description: ...FLOOD ADVISORY IN EFFECT UNTIL 630 PM EDT THIS EVENING... * WHAT...Flooding caused by excessive rainfall is expected. * WHERE...A portion of central Pennsylvania, including the following counties, Lancaster and York. * WHEN...Until 630 PM EDT. * IMPACTS...Minor flooding in low-lying and poor drainage areas. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS... - At 419 PM EDT, Doppler radar indicated heavy rain due to thunderstorms. Minor flooding is expected to begin shortly in the advisory area. Between 1 and 2 inches of rain have fallen. - Some locations that will experience flooding include... Willow Street, Red Lion, Shrewsbury, Quarryville, Stewartstown, Glen Rock, Cross Roads, Railroad, Brogue, Shenks Ferry, Safe Harbor, Sunnyburn, Holtwood, Smithville, Loganville, Conestoga, Winterstown, Felton, Refton and Airville. - http://www.weather.gov/safety/flood
info.instruction: Be aware of your surroundings and do not drive on flooded roads.
